intro: Ruehssia brenesii, commonly known as the Guanacaste tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in countries such as Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its large, compound leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas and dry forests. Ruehssia brenesii is valued for its hardy nature and is sometimes used in reforestation efforts due to its ability to stabilize soil.
